string.text: Includes maps, photos, and a floppy disc.
This is an ITEM test string
This is another ITEM test string

Powerful electronic lockpick. Strangely enough, it does not seem to be an all-purpose thieves' instrument. Rather, it seems to have been created with a specific electronic lock in mind and can't be used to override anything else.
Plastic document file. You'd need a degree in biology to understand a word of what it says.
A thick pile of scientific documents. Terms, formulas, and a number of diagrams

A thick stack of scientific papers, with the cover marked "Barrier Laboratory Project". There's some very interesting material: as it turns out, Darkscape - one of the first places the Zone spread to after its appearance, and the site of continued, repeated attempts to stop its spread - was largely destroyed and its tunnels sealed, to create special barriers allowing for active work to be carried out even after the Zone's spread.
A worn manuscript in leather binding, written by Strelok himself. Judging by the headings alone, it might explain some of the Zone's secrets.
Documents from the secret stash in Pripyat
A heavy wooden crate with the word "Explosives" written in several languages.
Flash drive - convenient way to store and transfer information.
Flash drive - a convenient way to store and transfer information.
Flash drive - a convenient way to store and transfer information.
Flash drive - a convenient way to store and transfer information.
Electronic key to the underground Lab X-18.
Personal digital assistant. Indispensable in the Zone.
Personal digital assistant. Indispensable in the Zone.
Prototype developed by scientists to protect people from psi-emissions. Not adjusted.
Functional prototype developed by scientists to protect people from psi-emissions

A GPS tracking beacon. Despite being relatively new technology in the Zone, it has become extremely popular for its affordable price and ease of use. The initial prototype was brought to Duty territory for presentation and to arrange a contract for future supplies of such beacons. But the "accidental" disappearance of a prototype before a representatives' meeting led to a breach in relations between the supplier and the customer. At this point, mutually-beneficial relations between Duty's General Voronin and Professor Sakharov were most useful. A local merchant provided the scientists at Yantar with a prototype, which was then modified slightly and mass-produced. This upgraded version has a number of advantages over the initial one, among which is the ability to add digital signatures to the beacon and sync them with the owner's PDA. Scientists from the psi-emission research lab also managed to minimize the beacon's radio interference, so that its discovery by an adversary is almost impossible. Sakharov's price for the beacon is much lower than that of other retailers, because they are manufactured in his bunker.

Professor:\n"Borov, I'm sending a note to you to keep you informed. Kulgaviy wants all the money for himself, so we need to have him killed. He's currently sitting in the northern farm of the Darkscape, together with four men, two of them with heavy weapons and armor. Make sure that neither he nor his subordinates learn of my affairs or the situation we are all in. Regards.\n Oh, and also: what the hell is up with the fourth flash drive, (something about a scandal at the sawmill and an old hunter). We ought to smoke him, but there's no time."
The key to the door of Freedom's arsenal.
Lukash's personal computer, which contains a wealth of information about Freedom and their operations in the Zone.
Flash drive №1. Contains information on the whereabouts of the Klondike of artifacts.
Flash drive №2. Contains information on the whereabouts of the Klondike of artifacts.
Flash drive №3. Contains information on the whereabouts of the Klondike of artifacts.
Flash drive №4. Contains information on the whereabouts of the Klondike of artifacts.
Flash drive №5. Contains information on the whereabouts of the Klondike of artifacts.
The effects of this artifact have not been studied.
This artifact is unique in that in a period of intense absorption of anomalous energy, it creates a weak spatial bubble around itself.
A scalp, removed from a supercontroller at Radar. Seems to glow slightly in complete darkness.
A container with a "Beehive" artifact inside.
An artifact which seems to be the source or a cause of the anomalous "plague-mutants".
An artifact which seems to be a source of an invisible energy field, which forms the space anomaly-trap.
An artifact which seems to produce inorganic, oily substances. Serves no practical purpose.
An artifact which acts as a source of microscopic static discharges, giving off sparks. The name comes from the discharges' similarity to electric arcs.
An artifact which serves as a constant source of light.
An artifact which serves as a source of pulsating, red light. Has no practical purpose. There's a legend that this artifact is formed at the place where a man was killed.

The most distinctive specimen of the "optical" or "wave" types of artifacts, constantly emitting some sort of light without a visible energy source. The artifact's bright rays rival those of electric lightbulbs. Protects against cuts and bullet wounds.
Formerly a kitchen utensil, this turned into an incomprehensible substance that lights up and levitates. This is definitely a subject of interest of scientists.
Formerly a kitchen utensil, this turned into an incomprehensible substance that lights up and levitates. This is definitely a subject of interest of scientists.
Formerly a kitchen utensil, this turned into an incomprehensible substance that lights up and levitates. This is definitely a subject of interest of scientists.
Formerly a kitchen utensil, this turned into an incomprehensible substance that lights up and levitates. This is definitely a subject of interest of scientists.
Formerly a kitchen utensil, this turned into an incomprehensible substance that lights up and levitates. This is definitely a subject of interest of scientists.
Formerly a toy, this has turned into an incomprehensible substance that lights up and levitates. This is definitely a subject of interest of scientists.

This artifact shares many traits with the mutant except the characteristic glow. Some stalkers believe that these stones are all that remains after a death of poltergeist; other say that they are just the mutants' waste product.
A strange toy, which seems left in an anomaly for a while. It's warm to the touch and smells like a wool coat.
An impulse scanner; a form of upgrade to the "Search" detector.
A tablet with maps belonging to the commander of expedition's guards.
Case of expedition guard commander. It's possible to open it and examine its contents.
Greetings, thugs! You're gonna come by real fast and release the guy you captured, or I'll remove your eyes and tear your jaws, I'm kidding you not. Regards, Borov.

This artifact seems to have no effect when placed on the belt, but if you cut this creation of the Zone in half, it will gain new properties without losing the old ones - teleporting his owner over a short distance. A rather unique artifact.

This is one of the pieces of the Magnet artifact. If you hang it on your belt, anomalous Zone effect will teleport you instantly to the missing part's location. Thus, both parts will "attract", and the artifact will be restored.

This is one of the pieces of the Magnet artifact. If you hang it on your belt, anomalous Zone effect will teleport you instantly to the missing part's location. Thus, both parts will "attract", and the artifact will be restored.
An artifact which warns about surge if worn on the belt. Also gives slight psy-protection.
Stalkers throw bolts into anomalies, without even knowing that sometimes they acquire some of the anomalies' properties.
A marble bust of Vladimir Lenin.
A fuel tank for a APC.
A machine gun modified by diggers. After it was tinkered with by the local "handyman", the gun stopped functioning.
A battered, shabby officer's tablet with notes from past experiences. Studying the tablet's content can shed light on the history of its former owner.
The tablet computer of the Prince of the Kulgavogo gang. The data contained within is available for download.
A detonator which sets off the charge on the road in the hollow.
Tablet of mercenary Denar. It contains documents that can be opened and read.
The tablet computer of stalker Renegade. The data contained within is available for download.
Zheka's tablet computer. The data contained within is available for download.
Digger Yuri's tablet computer. The data contained within is available for download.

A small, matchbox-sized piece of an unknown substance. The structure of the metal is reminiscent of steel, but it has a strange, light-brown color and some traces of melting. If crushed in your hand, it starts softly hissing and tingling on the skin. Serves no practical purpose, and most stalkers consider it trash.
A container with artifacts, which Barkeep sends outside of the Zone. It's made of bulletproof, refractory material, and closed with a double-combination lock.
A set of six rusty keys.

This device was assembled despite the strict regulations of military camps, and consists of a can, a hollow fire extinguisher and a jar for collection. The only person who can repair this is the forester Zakharych, who lives in the Hollow.
"Kordonovsky" moonshine. Hits your brain, according to stalker Tykar.
A glass of moonshine, 100 g capacity.
This book is the result of a stalker's creativity regarding the Zone and its inhabitants.
The Legend of the Black Stalker
Records of a scientist who explored an unknown anomaly.
A draft of an officer's report from the Dead City.
The note of sergeant Kuptsevich, who served in the military unit of a secret town before the Chernobyl incident.
A crumpled pack of "Belomorcanal" with writings on it
A mounted turret PKM. Must be assembled and installed on a flat surface before firing.
There's a bunch of household debt documents inside - invoices, statements, receipts, housing inventory. One of the inventories shows a safe №3156 and its code - 432. Hmm...

Recorded on the PDA: "Damn these bandits. I think they know something about our plans. I'll have to hide the flash drive in the underground railroad, in one of the wagons. I'll pick it up when I hike there. I'll have to follow Lukash's guys to avoid getting killed, they're going to Radar."

A short note on the use of the upgrade: switch to "search" in the pulse setting, select the frequency, press the button to send pulses and the device will begin to generate them. If the frequency is correct the artifact will fall out of the anomaly. However, the frequency of anomalies varies... yeah, there's more. The Dark Zones ruin your weapons and armor. You should remove all expensive gear, or you'll regret it later...
A powerful pulse generator. It can be used for great impact on the Dark Zones, being fused with special artifacts.
"The State and Revolution" by V.I. Lenin
A reissue of the 1917 work, printed in 1984. The book is somehow in excellent condition, the pages haven't even yellowed yet. The cover is also immaculate. The book is warm to the touch.
A reissue of the 1917 work, printed in 1982. The book is somehow in excellent condition, the pages haven't even yellowed yet. The cover is also immaculate. The book is warm to the touch.
"The Development of Capitalism in Russia" by V.I. Lenin
Lenin's 1899 monograph, reprinted in 1985. The book is somehow in excellent condition, the pages haven't even yellowed yet. The cover is also immaculate. The book is warm to the touch.
XX Congress of the CPSU. Verbatim Report. Volume 1.

A transcript of the report of the 20th Party Congress, at which Khrushchev denounced Stalin's Cult of Personality. The book is somehow in excellent condition, the pages haven't even yellowed yet. The cover is also immaculate. The book is warm to the touch. This is the first volume, surely the second has to be somewhere near.
XX Congress of the CPSU. Verbatim Report. Volume 2.

A transcript of the report of the 20th Party Congress, at which Khrushchev denounced Stalin's Cult of Personality. The book is somehow in excellent condition, the pages haven't even yellowed yet. The cover is also immaculate. The book is warm to the touch. This is the second volume, surely the first has to be somewhere near.

The note seems to have been glued to the safe. It's in very good condition, as if it was written yesterday. "Dear comrades! Do not throw the Party literature away! If Comrade Kozlov is not around to manage the library, put the books in the safe. He will take them and put them in the right place!"
An unknown type of artifact. Does not seem to have any effect. According to information from the flash drives, the artifact can activate Klondike of Artifacts.

A portable "friend-or-foe" transponder system. Used by all military stalkers in the Zone . The transponder transmits an encrypted signal to the military, which uniquely determines you as an ally. It is worn on the belt, and includes a biometric binding to a carrier, tracking features of the wearer's physiological characteristics. If transferred to another person, or if the wearer dies, the carrier automatically transmits a notice of death to the others, and then self-destructs, super-heating the device into mush. It behaves similarly when you try to open it. Externally, it looks similar to the standard GPS system, with a tightly-welded metal case. There are no buttons or switches present, only an engravement of your real name and nickname - "Anton Chernov (Strelok)". It's best to not show the inscription to anybody.
